title: Barnard Griffin 2016 Estate Bottled Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This wine's vibrant lime leaf, honeysuckle, orange peel, citrus and ripe peach aromas are followed by generous, just off-dry flavors. A touch of bitterness is all that holds it back.

title: Barnard Griffin 2016 Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Forward huckleberry and plum aromas lead to lightly sweet, easy-drinking fruit flavors in this wine. It's not very complex, but the price is right.

title: Bodegas Yuste NV Aurora Pedro Ximénez (Jerez)
description: This wine's raisin and dried plum aromas lose focus and turn grassy. There's a fine line between syrupy and rich, and this is more of the former. Chocolate is the main flavor, with the finish tasting like chocolate mousse.

title: Carmel 2015 Admon Vineyard Chardonnay (Galilee)
description: Aromas of pineapple and pear set the stage for flavors of pineapple, grapefruit, apple and hazelnut. This wine offers full mouthfeel and a citrus-drenched finish.

title: Casa Santos Lima 2016 Valcatrina by Santos Lima Red (Alentejano)
description: Soft and ripe with rich fruits and gentle tannins, this is a full-bodied wine. Its open black fruits, generous texture and poised structure all indicate that the wine is ready to drink.

title: Charles Krug 2014 Limited Release Voltz Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This 100% varietal wine is herbal and brushy, with a hint of celery root. Hugely tannic and creamy thick on the palate, it features layers of cherry, vanilla and sweet oak.

title: Château de Lavernette 2016  Bourgogne
description: This lightly oak-aged wine is ripe, with touches of apricots as well as crisper apple and quince flavors. Its smooth texture and hint of zesty orange flavor says this attractive, warm wine is ready to drink.

title: Cillar de Silos 2015 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: This crianza's rustic grilled meat and baking spice aromas are unfocused. It's jammy and soupy on the palate, with a soft structure, mild tannins and charred prune and berry flavors.

title: Contrada Salandra 2015 Falanghina (Campi Flegrei)
description: Aromas of sea brine and citrus lead the nose. The linear light-bodied palate shows bitter almond, ripe yellow apple skin, thyme and saline.

title: Domaine Chiroulet 2017 Soleil d'Automne White (Côtes de Gascogne)
description: This wine is sweet while light, delicate and freshly textured. Touches of honey are perfumed with white spring flowers, baked apple and pear, with a touch of spice at the end.

title: Domaine de Ménard 2017 Ménard Red (Côtes de Gascogne)
description: Blueberries and crisp, stalky black currants mark this wine. With its soft tannins and equally open red fruits, it is made for early and easy drinking. Drink now.

title: Dr. Fischer 2016 Riesling (Mosel)
description: Pronounced aromas of struck flint and earth lend savory intensity to more demure notes of pressed apple and pear here. Semidry and light bodied in style, it offers fresh lemony acidity and a refreshingly brisk finish. Drink now through 2020.

title: Earthworks 2016 Shiraz (Barossa)
description: A fairly straightforward Barossa Shiraz, this offers notes of ripe blueberry and black currant jam, with vanilla, black pepper and oak spice. While a little on the hot side, there's plenty of berry fruit and herbal spice to balance yet ultimately the oak comes across as slightly clunky and bitter on the finish.

title: Esser 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey County)
description: A slightly richer expression of the grape, this bottling shows ripe Asian pear, blanched almonds, baked apples and a slightly alkaline touch. The palate starts slightly sweet, with lemon-laced apple-pie flavors and finishes the same.

title: Eternal 2016 Eternal Bliss Patina Vineyard Fortified Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: It's rare to see a fortified wine from this appellation, let alone a single vineyard one. Made in a dry style, it brings barrel spice, herb and purple fruit aromas that prove intriguing but do not quite deliver

title: Fattoria Montecchio 2015  Chianti Classico
description: Earthy aromas of tilled soil combine with bell pepper and dark-skinned fruit. The straightforward palate evokes black plum, star anise and sage alongside smooth tannins.

title: Francis Coppola 2014 Kicker Cane Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa County-Sonoma County)
description: Grippy and thick in extracted flavors of blueberry and black cherry, this wine ultimately finds a lighter side to itself, ending simply in soft mellowed tannins and well-behaved oak.

title: Harmony Cellars 2015 Sangiovese (Paso Robles)
description: There's a strong earthy swath of wet clay and mud on the nose of this bottling along with dried cranberry and carnation petals. The palate is lacking a bit in acid and tannins, but the mellow flavors of light cranberry, pomegranate and gravel are quaffable.

title: Jalopy 2016 Guns N Rosé (Los Olivos District)
description: A slightly orange shade of pink, this bottling, whose label features both guns and roses, shows dried orange and tart watermelon on the nose. There's a tangy aspect to the sip, which is somewhat sticky in texture, with orange peel and apple flavors, with cherry and vanilla rising on the finish.

title: Kramer 2016 Celebrate Grüner Veltliner (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: Kramer's Celebrate series features non-traditional sparkling wine grapes that are carbonated in tank rather than re-fermented in the bottle. The Grüner Veltliner is the best of them; it captures the grape's peppery character in a bracing, bone-dry sparkler, with cucumber, lime and melon highlights.

title: La Fortezza 2016 Taburno  (Falanghina del Sannio)
description: Aromas of banana, exotic fruit and honeysuckle follow over to the juicy easygoing palate along with yellow apple and citrus. Fresh acidity lifts the fruity flavors.

title: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2016 L'Incomparable Beau Manseng Gros Manseng (Côtes de Gascogne)
description: White stone fruits, pineapple and light citrus flavors come together in this tangy, zesty and deliciously crisp wine. Fruity, refreshing and perfumed, it is ready to drink now.

title: Manimurci 2017 Zagreo  (Greco di Tufo)
description: This has a shy nose but the palate offers ripe orchard fruit, citrus and a hint of honey in a glycerin-like texture. Tangy acidity provides freshness.

title: Maquis 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)
description: This wine's spicy berry aromas are more herbal than outright ripe. It has a pulling, hard palate, with choppy tannins and generic plum and raspberry flavors laced with oaky clove notes. On the finish, it feels a bit raw and hollow.

title: Markus Wine Co 2015 Domo Red (Lodi)
description: Mellow flavors and a smooth luxurious texture make this medium-bodied wine easy to enjoy. Plum and cooked plum aromas lead to red cherry and black cherry on the palate.

title: Matarromera 2013 Granza Made From Organic Grapes  (Toro)
description: Prune and raisin aromas suggest overripeness in this wine. In the mouth, it's extracted and harsh, with raisin, baked plum and blackberry flavors and heavy tannins.

title: Messias 2015 Messias Unoaked Red (Douro)
description: Because it is unoaked, this wine is all about the generous fruits. It does have structure and fruit tannins as well as ripe berry fruits. The whole is finished with acidity and a dry aftertaste. Drink the wine from late 2018.

title: Palena 2017 Reserva Especial Sauvignon Blanc (Aconcagua Valley)
description: This wine's clean, minerally nose contains whiffs of lime and grass. It's firm but balanced, with a medium body and bracing acidity. Its lime and fruit salad flavors finish under control.

title: Quinta da Alorna 2016 Portal da Aguia Branco Fernão Pires-Moscatel White (Tejo)
description: A blend of Moscatel and Fernão Pires, this is perfumed and light, with acidity and spiced-pear flavors. It's fragrant, brightly textured and ready to drink.
designation: Portal da Aguia Branco Fernão Pires-Moscatel

title: Quinta da Mariposa 2014 Mariposa Branco White (Dão)
description: Showing the richness of Encruzado while also giving space to perfumed Cerceal and Malvasia, this is a mature wine, ripe and full of yellow fruits that have been softened with the four years' aging. Drink this wine now.
